item.title: 委内瑞拉与哥伦比亚公司就查韦斯时代的资产扣押问题进行谈判
item.description: 委内瑞拉社会主义政府正在与至少两家哥伦比亚公司商讨赔偿事宜，这些公司的资产在已故总统乌戈-查韦斯执政期间被没收。【原文：The socialist government of Venezuela is discussing compensation with at least two Colombian companies whose assets were seized under late President Hugo Chávez.】

item.title: 西弗吉尼亚州因石油问题禁止花旗和汇丰银行与银行签订合同
item.description: 西弗吉尼亚州财政部长宣布，他将限制四家金融服务公司为该州提供银行服务，因为他说这些公司 "抵制 "化石燃料行业。【原文：West Virginia’s treasurer announced that he is restricting four financial services firms from providing state banking services because he says they “boycott” the fossil fuels industry.】

item.title: 广达对冲基金全力投资三倍风险前沿领域
item.description: 总部位于伦敦的新兴市场宏观对冲基金 Broad Reach Investment Management 将其在前沿市场的所有现金分配投入到埃及、尼日利亚和巴基斯坦的复苏故事中，从而击败了同行。【原文：Broad Reach Investment Management, a London-based emerging-markets macro hedge fund, is beating peers by putting all of its cash allocation for frontier markets into recovery stories in Egypt, Nigeria and Pakistan.】

item.title: 美国通胀数据公布后，日元跌势面临决定性时刻
item.description: 渣打银行（Standard Chartered）称，受挫的日元一直在关键转折点和 34 年低点附近徘徊，但日本当局可能会等到本周晚些时候美国通胀数据公布后再出手支撑日元。【原文：The battered yen has been hovering near a critical turning point and a 34-year low but Japanese authorities are likely wait until a US inflation reading later this week before stepping in to prop up the yen, according to Standard Chartered.】

item.title: 富国银行是华尔街最看好 S&P 500 指数反弹的机构
item.description: 富国银行证券（Wells Fargo Securities）的克里斯托弗-哈维（Christopher Harvey）刚刚将华尔街 2024 年的最高目标定为 S&P 500 指数，因为他预计美国股市的涨势将持续到今年。【原文：Wells Fargo Securities’ Christopher Harvey just put Wall Street’s highest target on the S&P 500 Index for 2024 based on his expectation that the US equity rally will power on through the year.】

item.title: 日元干预风险令美联储现金储备膨胀成为焦点
item.description: 据花旗集团（Citigroup Inc.【原文：Japanese authorities will probably need to sell Treasuries in the event they step in to support the beleaguered yen, rather than just tapping cash parked in a key Federal Reserve facility, according to Citigroup Inc.】

item.title: 戴蒙称推动停止所有石油和天然气项目的做法非常幼稚
item.description: 杰米-戴蒙说，美国推迟液化天然气项目是出于 "政治原因"，目的是安抚那些认为应该停止石油和天然气项目的人。【原文：Jamie Dimon said US delays of liquefied natural gas projects were done for “political reasons” to pacify those who believe oil and gas projects should be stopped — a position he calls “wrong” and “enormously naïve.”】

item.title: 英国央行布里登称需要数字英镑来保持对货币的控制力
item.description: 英国央行副行长萨拉-布里登（Sarah Breeden）表示越来越支持数字英镑，称央行需要保持对货币的控制，以阻止信心崩溃的风险。【原文：Bank of England Deputy Governor Sarah Breeden signaled growing support for a digital pound, saying the central bank needs to maintain its grip on money to stop the risk of a collapse in confidence.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织（IMF）发现：中美紧张局势导致贸易和投资四分五裂
item.description: 国际货币基金组织的一项研究发现，全球经济正呈现出以美国和中国为中心的集团分化迹象，尽管其动态与冷战时期不同，整体分化程度较低，不结盟经济体的作用更大。【原文：The global economy is showing signs of dividing between US- and China-centered blocs, though the dynamics differ from the Cold War with less overall fragmentation and a greater role for non-aligned economies, an International Monetary Fund study found.】

item.title: 津巴布韦最新推出的稳定货币 ZiG
item.description: 为了设计一种可信的国家货币，津巴布韦又一次尝试用 ZiG（津巴布韦黄金的简称）取代美元。新货币单位由中央银行持有的金银和外汇储备支持。据国际货币基金组织估计，2008 年的通货膨胀率超过了 5000 亿个百分点。这不仅使其变得毫无价值，还使该货币单位成为全球的笑柄：美国【原文：In yet another attempt to devise a credible national currency, Zimbabwe has replaced its dollar with the ZiG, short for Zimbabwe Gold. The new unit is backed by bullion and foreign currency reserves held at the central bank. All told, the ZiG is the country’s sixth attempt at establishing its own currency since 2008, when inflation crossed 500 billion percent, according to International Monetary Fund estimates. Not only did that render it worthless, it turned the unit into a global punchline: US】

item.title: 泰晤士水务债权人集团在肯布尔违约后挑选顾问

item.title: 博茨瓦纳国营石油公司要求签订长期燃料合同
item.description: 博茨瓦纳国有石油公司计划在本月申请长期燃料合同，以保证这个非洲内陆国家的燃料供应。【原文：Botswana’s state-owned oil company plans to request long-term fuel contracts this month to keep the landlocked African nation supplied.】

item.title: 拜登的联合国特使将访问朝鲜非军事区
item.description: 美国驻联合国大使将前往朝鲜边境，拜登政府希望借此重申对亚洲盟友的支持，并提请人们注意安理会在遏制平壤核武库的努力上出现的团结破裂。【原文：The US ambassador to the United Nations will travel to the North Korean border as the Biden administration looks to reaffirm support for Asian allies and draw attention to a breakdown in Security Council unity over efforts to rein in Pyongyang’s nuclear arsenal.】

item.title: 名校信用评级因医院系统陷入困境而受到冲击
item.description: 与其他重点大学一样，南加州大学也投入了大量资源来扩建其医疗系统。但这是有代价的。【原文：Like other major universities, the University of Southern California has poured resources into expanding its health system. But it’s coming at a cost.】

item.title: LSEG 首席执行官 1,320 万英镑的潜在薪资待遇引关注
item.description: 一家著名的代理咨询公司鼓励伦敦证券交易所集团公司（London Stock Exchange Group Plc）的股东投票否决一项计划，该计划可能使公司首席执行官大卫-施维默（David Schwimmer）今年的工作薪酬增加一倍以上。【原文：A prominent proxy-advisory firm encouraged London Stock Exchange Group Plc shareholders to vote down a plan that could allow the company to more than double Chief Executive Officer David Schwimmer’s pay for his work this year.】

item.title: 乌克兰国家天然气公司在俄罗斯袭击后寻求天然气贸易商支持
item.description: 乌克兰最大的能源公司正寻求与欧洲天然气贸易商达成更多交易，以在今年增加燃料储存，尽管俄罗斯最近对其天然气基础设施发动了袭击。【原文：Ukraine’s biggest energy company is looking to strike more deals with European gas traders to boost fuel storage this year, despite recent Russian attacks on its gas infrastructure.】

item.title: Citadel 称下半年石油市场将 "极度紧张
item.description: 对冲基金 Citadel 的大宗商品部门主管表示，下半年全球石油市场将 "极度紧张"，如果欧佩克不恢复更多供应，价格将上涨到最终限制需求的水平。【原文：Global oil markets are on track to be “extremely tight” in the second half, with prices rising to a level that will eventually constrain demand if OPEC doesn’t bring back more supply, said the head of commodities at hedge fund Citadel.】

item.title: 3 月份俄罗斯外汇市场人民币交易量再次创下新高

item.description: 礼来公司（Eli Lilly & Co.）启动了一家新工厂的建设，以提高其广受欢迎的减肥药的产量。【原文：Eli Lilly & Co. kicked off construction of a new plant to boost the production of its wildly popular weight-loss drugs, which have yet to gain a foothold in Europe.】

item.title: 黑石支持的对冲基金 Antara 冻结非流动资产
item.description: 由黑石集团 (Blackstone Inc.) 支持、规模达 13 亿美元的对冲基金 Antara Capital 在亏损累累后冻结了其难以出售的资产，禁止赎回。【原文：Antara Capital, a $1.3 billion hedge fund backed by Blackstone Inc., froze its hard-to-sell assets from redemptions after piling on losses.】

item.title: 以色列为保护谢克尔和战争开支飙升而维持汇率
item.description: 以色列央行周一没有降息，而是把重点放在了提高通胀预期上，因为加沙战事动摇了经济，也损害了政府的财政状况。【原文：Israel refrained from cutting interest rates on Monday, with the central bank focusing on heightening inflation expectations as the war in Gaza shakes the economy and bruises the government’s fiscal standing.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织称，如果压力增加，私人信贷将面临流动性风险
item.description: 国际货币基金组织（International Monetary Fund）在一份报告中说，考虑到从对资金流动性的要求到基本借款人的质量等潜在问题，监管机构应更密切地审查快速增长的私人信贷市场。【原文：Regulators should scrutinize the fast-growing private-credit market more closely, given potential concerns ranging from demands on funds’ liquidity to the quality of underlying borrowers, the International Monetary Fund said in a report.】

item.title: Blackstone 将以 100 亿美元收购公寓业主 AIR
item.description: Blackstone Inc. 同意支付约 100 亿美元收购 Apartment Income REIT，这是房地产管理公司看到投资房地产时机成熟的最新迹象。【原文：Blackstone Inc. agreed to pay about $10 billion to acquire Apartment Income REIT, the latest sign that the real estate manager sees a ripe moment to invest in property.】

item.title: 奈德银行首席执行官称南非面临继续被列入 "脏钱 "名单的风险

item.title: 美国人对宠物的痴迷推动猫砂股反弹
